title: Bliss Packaging
content:
Franklin Gothic? The only thing throwing me off is the ear on the lowercase g.

[http://typophile.com/files/BLISS-287.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103758/http:/typophile.com/files/BLISS-287.jpg "http://typophile.com/files/BLISS-287.jpg")

[http://typophile.com/files/BLISS-279.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103758/http:/typophile.com/files/BLISS-279.jpg "http://typophile.com/files/BLISS-279.jpg")

author: armin

comments.content:
pretty sure its Franklin Gothic No.2

[http://www.identifont.com/show?1YP](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103758/http:/www.identifont.com/show?1YP)

The ear on the lowercase g looks perfectly Franklin Gothic.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103758im_/http:/typophile.com/files/get_6648.png)

ITC Franklin Gothic, which I was first looking at, has a higher ear...  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-franklin-gothic/heavy/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025103758/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-franklin-gothic/heavy/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-franklin-gothic/heavy/")

Thanks fellas.
